title: Canadian snowmobile registrations by province 2018
summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Province, and Number of registrations in each Province on the y axis.
The maximum Number of registrations 201732.0 is found at Province Quebec and the minimum is found at Yukon where Province is 1805.0.
Province Yukon has 111.76 times less Number of registrations than Province Quebec which is the highest.
min_summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Province, and Number of registrations in each Province on the y axis.
Province Quebec has the highest Number of registrations and Yukon has the lowest Number of registrations.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Province, and Number of registrations in each Province on the y axis.
The maximum Number of registrations 201732.0 is found at Province Quebec and the minimum is found at Yukon where Province is 1805.0.
Province Yukon has 111.76 times less Number of registrations than Province Quebec which is the highest.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of registrations for 13 number of Provinces.
The maximum Number of registrations 201732.0 is found at Province Quebec and the minimum is found at Yukon where Province is 1805.0.
Province Ontario has the second highest value for Number of registrations.
The difference of Number of registrations between the highest and lowest Province is 199927.0.
The Province Quebec has the highest Number of registrations, followed by Ontario, and Alberta. Down to the Province Yukon which is the lowest.
Considered together, the average Number of registrations in all 13 Provinces is roughly 49168.92.
